pattern.name: Decimals
pattern.description:
Returns the count of decimal digits.
Note: Useful only for numbers that can contain decimals.
pattern.example: Energy consumption in kWh/year entered by the web visitor. If they enter something like 1986.724, it is more likely to be an exact value than 1986.
pattern.author: Jan Motl
pattern.code: SELECT @base , case when length(cast(@numericalColumn as varchar)) - length(cast(round(@numericalColumn) as varchar)) > 0 then length(cast(@numericalColumn as varchar)) - length(cast(round(@numericalColumn) as varchar)) -1 else 0 end AS @columnName FROM @propagatedTable WHERE @numericalColumn is not null
